title: Understanding ORDER BY Clause
text: The ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. It can sort in ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC) order.

title: Using ORDER BY with Multiple Columns
text: To sort by multiple columns, list the columns separated by commas in the ORDER BY clause.

title: Syntax for ORDER BY
text: The basic syntax for the ORDER BY clause is: ORDER BY $$column_{name1}$$ [ASC|DESC], $$column_{name2}$$ [ASC|DESC], ...

title: Example of ORDER BY with Multiple Columns
text: Consider a table with columns $$'first_{name'}$$ and $$'last_{name'}$$. How would you order the results first by $$'last_{name'}$$ and then by $$'first_{name'}$$?
